alert.note: Alert for Custer; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 3:32PM CDT until July 09 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Washita River near Clinton affecting Washita and Custer Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Washita River near Clinton. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Near bankfull conditions occur along the Washita River... from areas near the mouth of Barnitz Creek... to near Clinton in Custer County... and downstream to near the town of Cloud Chief in Washita County. Flooding is limited to only bottom lands where smaller streams enter the Washita River valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 16.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The Washita River is cresting now. It will fall below 16 feet, but then is expected to rise to a crest of 16.5 feet again tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 345 AM CDT.
